subdisciplines.name: Performance art
subdisciplines.description: A form of art in which the artist uses their body, voice, or other elements to create a work of art that is typically only performed once.

subdisciplines.name: Installation art
subdisciplines.description: Artwork created by combining and arranging objects within a specific space, often outside of a traditional gallery or museum setting.

subdisciplines.name: Video art
subdisciplines.description: Visual art that uses video as its primary medium. Often includes elements of performance, installation, and traditional filmmaking.

subdisciplines.name: Conceptual art
subdisciplines.description: Art that emphasizes idea over aesthetic or emotional qualities. Often takes the form of instructions, documentation, or other non-traditional mediums.

subdisciplines.name: Digital art
subdisciplines.description: Art created using digital technology, often involving computer-generated images, animation, or interactive installations.
